name: Rita

perks.name: Blind Devil
perks.description: Requirements: Permanently Blinded. Attuning to your loss of sight has made your other senses sharper, and you can sense your surroundings with pinpoint accuracy. You can effectively “see” any target within a number of feet equal to 5 x your Perception score. Additionally, your passive sense increases by 5 and you have advantage on Combat Sequence rolls. {Passive Sense +5}

perks.name: Hardware Upgrade
perks.description: Requirements: Robot, Not Gen-2 Synth. You can choose any 2 weapons to become Integrated Weapons, so long as you have the caps to purchase them, the materials to craft them, or you have the weapons in your inventory. The weapons you choose have their Carry Load halved, they cost no AP to equip or stow, and they cannot be detached from you unless the arm is severed. The chosen weapons retain all properties. You can only have one Integrated Weapon per arm. If you already have an Integrated Weapon in one of your arms, you can choose to replace it with a new weapon.

traits.name: *Cybernetic Augmentation
traits.description: Requirements: Human, Ghoul, or Super Mutant You’ve enhanced your physical form with robotic components. You can now heal up to half your Healing Rate with Robot Repair Kits, however you are now weak to Electricity damage. Wild Wasteland: In addition to this trait’s effects, you can now take Robot perks, however you no longer gain any effects from chems, nor any of the positive effects from food and drinks.

traits.name: Talented
traits.description: You gain an extra perk at 1st level, however 5 different Skill modifiers of your choice are decreased by 3. {Crafting -3} {Guns -3} {Science -3} {Survival -3} {Unarmed -3}

notes: Combat Doctor = +2 to Breach, Medicine, and Energy Weapon.

perks.name: Randomizer
perks.description: Min. Luc. Required: 6. Introduce a little chaos into the mix! Certain interactions now have the chance to randomly change, for better or for worse. When you craft or repair an item, you can optionally choose one of the required materials to randomize. The chosen material has its required amount decreased by your Luck modifier, to a minimum of 1, and it is replaced by a different, random material. Roll a 1d6 to determine the Rarity Tier of the chosen material, then another 1d6 to determine the material itself (rolling a 6 counts as a 5). See Crafting and Repair for the list of materials. Additionally, whenever you consume a food, drink, or chem, you can optionally choose to roll a Luck check with a DC of 15. If you succeed, the item gains an additional property from the Chem Properties table. Roll a d12 to determine the effect using the Chem Properties table, not counting Super Stimulant and Hyperstimulant. Additionally, whenever you buy or sell an item, you can optionally choose to randomly change the price of the item by rolling a d100, which determines the percentage to be applied to the base cost of the item. You can only do this once per item, and you cannot make any Barter skill checks or use your Discount ability to change the cost afterwards

perks.name: Farmer
perks.description: Born on a wide swath of land, or inherited by family, or gifted by some rich benefactor. You only know your life to be working the land to bring one of the most valuable resources in the wasteland, food. You know how to cook, what kind of creatures taste the best, and how to fix up just about anything. Being this savvy in the wasteland often draws eyes, and you’ve seen your share of those who will do anything to take what you have built. Either something has befallen your crop, your animals have gone sick, or one of those desperate folks finally torched your home. Either way, you’re wandering the wasteland to rebuild or repair your farm. {Crafting +2} {Intimidation +2} {Survival +2}

traits.name: Proper Maintenance
traits.description: You ignore the first 2 levels of Decay for armor or weapons. However, your equipment becomes non-functional when they reach 8 levels of Decay instead of 10. Wild Wasteland: You ignore the first 4 levels of Decay for armor or weapons. However, your equipment becomes non-functional when they reach 6 levels of Decay instead of 10.

traits.name: Adventurer’s Instinct
traits.description: Whenever you roll a Luck or Perception ability check to search a room for items, you have advantage. However, any weapons or armor you find have an additional level of Decay. Wild Wasteland: Whenever you search for items, you have advantage and can reroll one of the dice. However, any weapons or armor you find have 2 additional levels of Decay.

backgrounds.name: Wastelander
backgrounds.description:
All you’ve ever needed was what’s on your back. You’ve traveled far and wide across the wasteland, trading, meeting folks, and moving on. You’ve killed raiders, explored abandoned ruins, and crossed paths with soldiers. You’re as impactful to this world as a tumbleweed in the desert, but all of that is about to change.
 {Guns +2} {Survival +2} {Unarmed +2}

traits.name: Adventurer’s Instinct
traits.description: Whenever you roll a Luck or Perception ability check to search a room for items, you have advantage. However, any weapons or armor you find have an additional level of Decay.

inventory.name: Bag (Backpack)
inventory.description: A leather, burlap, or cloth bag with straps. | If you wear more than one bag that has items stored in it, you are Encumbered unless STR or END >= 8.

inventory.name: Leather Armor
inventory.description: A jacket, fittings around the arms, knee pads, and boots all fall under leather armor.

inventory.name: Leather Armor
inventory.description: A jacket, fittings around the arms, knee pads, and boots all fall under leather armor.
